stories.title: Germany Halts Nord Stream 2, a Key Russian Natural Gas Pipeline

stories.text:
I posted this on reddit over the weekend and had 179k views & 2k upvotes. Someone mentioned I should also post on HN. Interested to see what you all think/your ideas as well.

-

I've been thinking of putting together a book/repo on the financial info/lessons I wish I knew before entering tech. There is a lot of general information on financial advice, but very little tailored explicitly for tech employees. With so many jobs now paying $100k+ out of college, I thought - What financial info would I have wanted to know when I was jumping into tech?

With the correct information and execution, most of you can set yourselves up for a very comfortable life.

I've worked at a wide range of tech companies, running into most of the situations you will most likely encounter in your tech career. In the last decade, my income grew dramatically. When I joined Yelp early on, I made $30k base + stock options. At Netflix, my salary was over $300k.

Here's everywhere I've worked -

    Yelp (Pre-IPO)- joined @ 50-75 employees.

    Redbeacon (joined @ 5 employees - acquired by Home Depot)

    SimpleGeo (~20 employees - acquired by Airship)

    Tindie (founded, raised VC, sold)

    Netflix
Things I wish I had known when entering the tech world -

    Reviewing companies & selecting the right opportunity

    Salaries, pay raises, and how packages are structured

        Startups vs big companies

    Stock options vs RSUs - how they work, exercising them, the tax implications.

    Bonuses - what to expect and also the tax implications

    Investing in your retirement (401ks, IRAs, etc)

    Real estate - renting in these high costs of living areas vs buying

    Tech investing - becoming an angel investor & VC investing

    Contract work - how to bill & taxes
What else would you like to be covered?

I am going to write in public at this repo. Feel free to create an issue for a topic you'd like to see.

Repo: https://github.com/emilepetrone/financial_advice

Mailing-list: https://financial.carrd.co/

Hopefully, this will be helpful to everyone looking to jump into tech or are just starting their careers.
stories.title: Financial lessons after 10 years in tech

stories.text:
This covers ruby basics in ~20 minutes:

https://github.com/stevecondylios/ruby-learning-resources/blob/master/ruby.md#first-things-first

I made it to hedge against my forgetfulness after binge-reading ruby books knowing if I wanted to retain any of this new material I'd need minimal examples that I could easily rerun when needed.

This is the resulting ruby refresher starting from the absolute basics.
stories.title: Show HN: Learn Ruby in 1 Page
